Spike Data API#

class spk2py.spike_data.SpikeData(filepath: Path | str, exclude: tuple = ('Respirat', 'Sniff', 'RefBrain'))#

Container class for Spike2 data.

Can be used as: - A dictionary, where the keys are the channel names and the values are the waveforms (LFP + Unit). - A list, where the elements are the channel names. - A boolean, where True means the file is empty and False means it is not. - A string, where the string is the filename stem.

property bandpass_high#

The upper bound of the bandpass filter.

Returns:
intThe upper bound of the bandpass filter.
property bandpass_low#

The lower bound of the bandpass filter.

bundle_metadata()#

Bundle the metadata into a dictionary.

Returns:
metadatadict

A dictionary containing the metadata.

channel_interval(channel: int)#

Get the waveform sample interval, in clock ticks. Used by channels that sample equal interval waveforms and equal to the number of file clock ticks per second.

channel_max_ticks(channel: int)#

Get the last time-point in the array, in ticks.

Parameters:
channelint

The channel number.

Returns:
last_timefloat

The last time point, in ticks.

channel_max_time(channel: int)#

Get the last time-point in the channel-array, in seconds.

channel_num_ticks(channel: int)#

Get the number of clock ticks in the channel.

Parameters:
channelint

The channel number.

Returns:
ticksfloat

The number of clock ticks.

channel_sample_period(channel: int)#

Get the waveform sample period, in seconds. Used by channels that sample

Parameters:
channelint

The channel number.

Returns:
samplefloat

The waveform sample interval, in seconds.

property max_channels#

The number of channels in the file.

property max_ticks#

The total number of clock ticks in the file.

property postinfusion#

Check if the filename contains the post-infusion suffix.

property preinfusion#

Check if the filename contains the pre-infusion suffix.

process_units()#

Extracts unit data from the Spike2 file.

property recording_length#

The total recording length, in seconds.

property time_base#

The number of seconds per clock tick.

Everything in the file is quantified by the underlying clock tick (64-bit). All values in the file are stored, set and returned in ticks. You need to read this value to interpret times in seconds.

Returns:
float

The time base, in seconds.
